meanings.definition: The condition of having a symmetrical tail fin
meanings.sent1: Fish with homocercies have tail fins that are perfectly balanced on both sides.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the homocercies of various fish species to understand their swimming patterns.
meanings.sent3: The fish at the talent show proudly displayed their homocercies while swimming in synchronized patterns.
meanings.sent4: The homocercies of the fish reminded me of the perfectly aligned wings of a bird in flight.
meanings.sent5: The aquarium guide explained how homocercies help fish maintain stability in the water.

meanings.sent1: The homocercies of the fish made it easier for them to navigate through the coral reef.
meanings.sent2: The homocercies of the shark allowed it to swiftly move through the ocean waters.
meanings.sent3: The fish's homocercies were so symmetrical that they almost looked like a work of art.
meanings.sent4: The homocercies of the dolphin symbolized harmony and balance in nature.
meanings.sent5: The homocercies of the whale were a testament to the beauty of marine life.
